programme.title: Krimināli smieklīgi
programme.desc: Noziedznieki mēdz būt neģēlīgi, zemiski, baisi, nekrietni un arī... krimināli smieklīgi. Šī ir tava iespēja savām acīm skatīt dažus no nejēdzīgākajiem, dīvainākajiem un idiotiskākajiem noziedzniekiem, ko šī planēta var piedāvāt. Videonovērošanas kadri un ar telefonu uzņemti aculiecinieku video, kas liks nosarkt likumpārkāpēja vietā. No zagļiem, ko aizraida vecas, sirmas kundzītes, līdz caur griestiem krītošiem laupītājiem – skaties un uzjautrinies!

programme.title: Lielceļš cauri ellei 7
programme.desc: Leģendārā smagā glābšanas dienesta operatoru Džeimiju Deivisu un viņa komandu gaida jauna sezona, jauni izaicinājumi un jaunas, bīstamas glābšanas operācijas. Viens no ekonomiski nozīmīgākajiem kravu pārvadājumu maršrutiem Ziemeļamerikā – vieta, kur laikapstākļi mainās strauji. Sniegputeņi ziemā, lietusgāzes vasarā: cik smagu avāriju sekas nāksies nokopt glābšanas komandai? Arvien lielu izaicinājumu sagādās aprīkojums, ar ko Džeimija komandai jāstrādā, tomēr glābējiem allaž padomā šādi tādi slepenie ieroči.

programme.title: Klikt
programme.desc: Maikls Ņūmens smagi strādā, lai apgādātu ģimeni un izdabātu bosam cerībā uz paaugstinājumu. Problēma ir tā, ka viņš pārāk maz laika pavada kopā ar ģimeni, un sāk vēlēties pulti, ar kuras palīdzību varētu kontrolēt savu dzīvi. Sev par pārsteigumu drīz vien viņa vēlmes piepildās – viņš satiek Mortiju, pustraku pārdošanas aģentu, kuram pieder pults, ar kuras palīdzību var ar dzīvi darboties līdzīgi kā ar video - apstādināt to, pārtīt vai izslēgt skaņu. Beidzot viss viņa dzīvē ir nokārtojies! Viņš var ne tikai pārtīt nepatīkamos dzīves mirkļus, bet arī uzreiz nokļūt kārotajā amatā. Viss ir lieliski līdz brīdim, kamēr pults sabojājas…

programme.title: Zebra. Zebra Yr 9 (2025) Ep. 913
programme.desc: Raidījuma vadmotīvs ir nemainīgs – drošība un ātrums! Tēmu loks tāpat – satiksmes drošība, satiksmes organizācija un iespējamie risinājumi. Transportlīdzekļu vadītājiem un gājējiem saistošu likumu un noteikumu izmaiņas, Eiropas valstu pieredze satiksmes problēmu risināšanā. Sava daļa stāstu būs atvēlēta sportiem, kas saistīti ar ātrumu. Raidījums visiem, kas ceļā! Raidījuma vadītājs – Pauls Timrots.

programme.title: Sporta notikumu tops
programme.desc: Iespaidīgi stāsti par nozīmīgākajiem mirkļiem un personībām sportā. Desmit neaizmirstamākās debijas, desmit vērtīgākie pionieri sportā, visu laiku lieliskākās atgriešanās un citi aizraujoši notikumi, kas atstājuši nospiedumu pasaules sporta vēstures lappusēs.

programme.title: Pārkāpt robežu 3
programme.desc: Volters Vaits ir ķīmijas skolotājs. Viņam jau ir dēls invalīds un sieva gaida vēl vienu bērnu. Skolotāja alga ir maza, tādēļ Volters piestrādā automazgātavā, kur skolnieki labprāt izmanto iespēju gan par viņu, gan slimo dēlu paņirgāties. Voltera svainis savukārt strādā Narkotiku apkarošanas nodaļā un reiz Volteram piedāvā iespēju piedalīties operācijā kādā metamfetamīna laboratorijā. Operācijas laikā Volts redz, kā viens dīleris aizbēg, un tas izrādās viņa bijušais skolnieks. Volts nolemj sākt nodarboties ar narkotiku ražošanu, jo zaudēt vairs nav ko – dakteris ir paziņojis, ka viņam ir plaušu vēzis. Volts kopā ar jauno pārinieku noīrē treileri, kuru pārtaisa par laboratoriju un nogādā tuksneša vidū. Var jau būt, ka šis bizness ir ienesīgs, bet tas prasa stiprus nervus...

programme.title: Pārkāpt robežu 3

programme.title: Kā rūpnīcas mainīja pasauli
programme.desc: Masveida ražošana ir nozīmīga mūsu dzīves daļa, taču tā dod iespēju ne tikai radīt un būvēt, bet arī iznīcināt un patērēt kā vēl nekad agrāk. Raidījumā tiek salīdzinātas pagātnes, tagadnes un nākotnes rūpnīcas, sākot no smagās rūpniecības un kara tehnikas izgatavošanas, līdz rūpnīcām, kas ražo pārtiku, apģērbu un citas ikdienas preces. Tāpat tiek novērtēta rūpnīcu ietekme uz apkārtējo ainavu, pilsētām un kultūru. Šī būs iespēja arī ielūkoties jaunāko tehnoloģiju sasniegumos un izzināt, kā rūpniecība varētu izskatīties nākotnē.

programme.title: Krimināli smieklīgi
programme.desc: Noziedznieki mēdz būt neģēlīgi, zemiski, baisi, nekrietni un arī... krimināli smieklīgi. programme.title: Mini pa trim 2
programme.desc: Attapības spēle ģimenei un draugiem, kuru vada aktieris Mārtiņš Počs. Spēle norisināsies “Draudzīgajā kafejnīcā”, kur vairākās kārtās tiek meklētas pareizās atbildes uz dažādiem jautājumiem. Spēle norisinās, sacenšoties trim komandām, kurās apvienojušās sabiedrībā pazīstamas personas ar ģimeni vai draugiem!

programme.title: Gāzi grīdā: ziemas prieki.
programme.desc: Džeremijs Klārksons, Ričards Hemonds un Džeimss Mejs piedāvā savu labāko ziemas izaicinājumu izlasi. Kad zemi klāj sniegs un ledus, ar automašīnām taču var darīt tik daudz ko jautru! Piemēram, sacensties ātrumā ar bobsleju, spēlēt hokeju ar miniatūrām Suzuki automašīnām, kā arī noskaidrot, vai, braucot ar Ferari no Lielbritānijas līdz slēpošanas kūrortiem var nonākt ātrāk kā ar lidmašīnu.

programme.title: Pārkāpumi sportā
programme.desc: Ieskats profesionālā sporta sarežģītajā pasaulē. Intervijas, arhīvu materiāli un pētnieciski ziņojumi atklās skandālu, sāncensības un slavas psiholoģisko ietekmi uz sportistiem un komandām.

programme.title: Krietnie zagļi 3
programme.desc: Kādreiz Neitans Fords bija apdrošināšanas firmas izmeklētājs. Tagad viņš saaicinājis komandā vislabākos bijušos noziedzniekus. Viņi palīdz tiem cilvēkiem, kuri nevēlas vai nespēj atrisināt savas problēmas ar likumīgām metodēm un policijas palīdzību. Parasti tas nozīmē, ka viņiem ir jāapkrāpj blēži, kas iedzīvojušies uz sveša īpašuma rēķina un bieži vien pat skaitās sabiedrībā cienījami ļaudis. Neita komandā ietilpst datorģēnijs un hakeris Aleks Hārdisons, zagle un trakulīga dāma Pārkere, aktrise un krāpniece Sofija un plaša profila speciālists Eliots. Šie ļaudis ir retums, īstas pērles – zagļu komanda, par kuru godīgie tur īkšķi, lai viņiem izdodas!

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: No zēna par vīru 2
programme.desc: Ceļotājs Tims Nūnans dodas episkā piedzīvojumā uz pasaules skarbākajām vietām, lai savām acīm ieraudzītu dažus no pasaules sīkstākajiem vīriem. Dokumentālajās sērijās atklājas piedzīvojumu meklētāja divus gadus ilgais ceļojums uz nomaļiem pasaules nostūriem Brazīlijā, Kamerūnā, Kirgizstānā, Madagaskarā, Meksikā, Mongolijā, Jaungvinejā, Krievijā, Taizemē un Venecuēlā. Tur viņš iepazina maz pētītu cilšu kultūru, pamazām iemantoja iezemiešu uzticību un visbeidzot – piedzīvoja bīstamākos pilngadības rituālus un pārbaudījumus, kādi saglabājušies līdz mūsdienām.

programme.title: Pasaules spēkavīru čempionāts 2024
programme.desc: Pasaules spēkavīru sacensības pārbauda stiprinieku absolūtās robežas, metot izaicinājumu ne tikai viņu fiziskajam spēkam, bet arī veiklībai un garīgajai izturībai. Starp dalībniekiem arī Latvijas spēkavīrs Aivars Šmaukstelis, kuram pieder vairāki Ginesa rekordi.

programme.title: Aplaupīšana vētras laikā
programme.desc: Alabamas un Floridas štatiem tuvojas postoša viesuļvētra. Tā kā pirms 20 gadiem līdzīga vētraiznīcināja kādu piekrastes pilsētu, šoreiz tiek izsludināta evakuācija. Pilsētā šai laikā ir nogādāta vecānauda uz iznīcināšanu, taču saplīsis smalcinātājs – vētra ir ideāls laiks, lai veiktu ideālo laupīšanu uniegūt šo naudu. Tomēr vētra izrādās krietni vien spēcīgāka, nekā meteorologi ir paredzējuši, un drīzvien sākas cīņa uz dzīvību un nāvi.

programme.title: Basketbols: NBA 2024/25. Los Angeles Lakers - Oklahoma City Thunder
Sporta momenti
programme.desc: Dokumentālās sērijas aplūko aizraujošos stāstus, ko atklāj slavenākās fotogrāfijas sporta vēsturē. Iemūžinātie mirkļi ataino spilgtākos divdesmitā gadsimta atlētus, kā arī ilustrē svarīgus momentus, kas mainījuši sporta vēstures gaitu.

programme.title: A Justice of Terror
programme.desc: We reveal how laws were used by the Nazis to justify the unjustifiable and authorise the most heinous of crimes, and we also learn what role jurists played in this reinterpretation of law.

programme.title: D-Day: The Soldiers Story
programme.sub-title: Giles Milton visits key D-Day sites along the Normandy coastline - including Omaha Beach and Pegasus Bridge - and we hear the stories of the men and women on both the attacking and defensive lines.
programme.desc: A two-part documentary that tells the story of D-Day - June the 6th, 1944 like its never been told before as presenter Giles Milton reveals an astonishing tale of fear, courage and heroism.

programme.title: Genghis Khans Mongolia
programme.sub-title: This first episode charts Chinggis Khaans childhood as an outcast living in harsh conditions on the barren landscape - before he rose up and united all of the nomadic communities across the steppe.
programme.desc: We explore the evolution of the Mongol Empire, from its humble beginnings to becoming an extraordinary force; they conquered vast territories and came to be four times larger than the Roman Empire.

programme.title: Crucifixion Bones
programme.desc: In 2017, an ordinary archaeological dig in the Cambridgeshire Fens turns up a sensational discovery when the best-preserved example of a Roman crucifixion ever discovered is unearthed.

programme.title: JFK: The Home Movie That Changed the World
programme.desc: The remarkable story of the home movie footage that captured the assassination of President John F. Kennedy; Abraham Zapruder became the crucial person who filmed the moment the world changed forever.

programme.title: JFK: The Final Evidence
programme.sub-title: CIA and American politics experts pick apart the historical facts that surround the assassination as we look back on the events that led up to the 1960 US Presidential campaign.
programme.desc: We explore the mystery behind the assassination of President John F. Kennedy and reflect with new eyes as a recent document release from the US Government helps us separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: JFK: The Final Evidence
programme.sub-title: With a better understanding of JFKs political career and the movements of Lee Harvey Oswald, we now need to dig a little deeper; who is really responsible, and will we ever know all the details?
programme.desc: We explore the mystery behind the assassination of President John F. Kennedy and reflect with new eyes as a recent document release from the US Government helps us separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: We discover an intriguing new theory about Gobekli Tepe in southern Turkey; one of the worlds oldest mysteries dating back over 12,000 years, we still dont understand who built it or why.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: The struggle for victory necessitated development of gun technologies; new inventions would emerge on the battlefields and at times surprise soldiers on both sides of the fight.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II fostered the emergence of both iconic and unusual tanks that were each engineered with distinct aims; we explore diverse tank innovations and the overall trajectory of armoured warfare.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II ignited a fierce battle for aerial dominance and drove nations to pioneer secret aircraft technologies; this episode explores the development of early jet fighters.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: World War II was a battle for supremacy at sea more than any other conflict before or since; in this episode, we explore how the secret weapons of naval warfare changed the tides of history.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: WWII facilitated the use of technology to wreak destruction from afar; through success and failure, the bomb was and remains a weapon that can tip the balance in favour of those who wield its power.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: Secret Weapons: WWII
programme.sub-title: Espionage and intelligence were crucial during WWII; clever camouflage, the Enigma machine, and concealable weapons were as important as any tank, ship, aircraft or bomb.
programme.desc: This series highlights how WWII fuelled technological leaps leading to jet planes and space rockets; each episode delves into different weapon categories and offers insights into wartime engineering.

programme.title: The Fascists and the Freemasons
programme.desc: Nazism and fascism shared a hatred for the Freemasons, the most powerful society of their times; we investigate the reasons for fascisms obsession with Freemasonry and uncover its consequences.

programme.title: Nazi Killing Fields
programme.desc: March 1945: a special unit of the SS feels disturbed by wandering forced labourers in the West when their commander orders a massacre; this was a war crime that remained unpunished for decades.

programme.title: A Justice of Terror
programme.desc: We reveal how laws were used by the Nazis to justify the unjustifiable and authorise the most heinous of crimes, and we also learn what role jurists played in this reinterpretation of law.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.sub-title: A seafaring people called the Rapa Nui flourished on Easter Island hundreds of years ago, but they succumbed to a series of deadly events that saw the entire civilisation destroyed.
programme.desc: Why do civilisations collapse? Follow archaeologists as they examine ruins across the world and uncover the reasons why some of historys greatest civilisations vanished.

programme.title: Hitlers Power
programme.sub-title: How could a nobody become a dictator and bring down a democracy in just a few years, what crucial events helped Hitler gain respectability and influence, and who were his supporters?
programme.desc: What led the Germans to support the Holocaust? This three-part series takes a closer look at the relationship between dictator Adolf Hitler and the German people.

programme.title: Hitlers Power
programme.sub-title: How did Hitler succeed in transforming a republic into a Fuhrer state in such a short time, how did the enforced conformity of society take place, and how willingly did the Germans fall in line?
programme.desc: What led the Germans to support the Holocaust? This three-part series takes a closer look at the relationship between dictator Adolf Hitler and the German people.

programme.title: Hitlers Power

programme.desc: What led the Germans to support the Holocaust? This three-part series takes a closer look at the relationship between dictator Adolf Hitler and the German people.

programme.title: Scanning the Nile
programme.sub-title: In northern Egypt, off of the coast of Alexandria, we set off on a journey to discover the incredible stories of two ancient sunken cities at the mouth of the Nile.
programme.desc: We get a glimpse at the immense role played by the sacred river in the growth of ancient Egypt; with the use of the latest technology, we witness how the river evolved over the centuries.

programme.title: Scanning the Nile
programme.sub-title: In the region of Cairo, the Nile fertilised the earth, but it also provided water to the canals that were used for the construction of the pyramids, among other things.
programme.desc: We get a glimpse at the immense role played by the sacred river in the growth of ancient Egypt; with the use of the latest technology, we witness how the river evolved over the centuries.

programme.title: Scanning the Nile
programme.sub-title: Built on the shores of the Nile, Luxor is home to the greatest monuments of the New Kingdom: the Karnak complex, the temple of Denderah, and the million-year-old castle of Ramesses II.
programme.desc: We get a glimpse at the immense role played by the sacred river in the growth of ancient Egypt; with the use of the latest technology, we witness how the river evolved over the centuries.

programme.title: Scanning the Nile
programme.sub-title: The first cataract of the Nile cuts through Aswan, making it a natural border and a gateway to the gold of the Pharaohs; we dive into the waters of Elephantine Island to discover the oldest Nilometer.
programme.desc: We get a glimpse at the immense role played by the sacred river in the growth of ancient Egypt; with the use of the latest technology, we witness how the river evolved over the centuries.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Emperor: The Rise and Fall of a Dynasty
programme.sub-title: Livia, the first empress of Rome, came to regret the scheming that put her son Tiberius on the throne as he and his heir Caligula dragged the empire into an age of tyranny and shocking depravity.
programme.desc: Delve into the most tumultuous era in Roman history with the stories of the first five emperors - and the powerful women behind them - told through the eyes of Livia, the matriarch of the Caesar clan.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: What secrets did the Nazis hope to find inside the cells and DNA of the human body? Some of the most nauseating Nazi experiments were performed in the name of creating a pure Aryan race.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: WWII was a war in the skies; though the Treaty of Versailles had prevented the Germans from developing new weapons, they sponsored air clubs and pushed for supremacy in the air.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: Adolf Hitler was famously against using chemical and biological weapons, but chemistry and biological science still played an incredible role in the Nazis unquenchable quest for power.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: What would it take to bomb the Allies into the ground? This was the question on the minds of top Nazi brass as they mobilised Germanys top scientists to create frightening new bombs.
programme.desc: When the Nazi empire collapsed at the end of WWII, the darkest secrets of the Third Reich came to light; this series exposes everything from biological experiments to supersize feats of engineering.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Science
programme.sub-title: Science was a tool to help the war effort for the Nazis; how could a Nazi soldier and its leadership be optimised, and what secret Nazi plans can we glean from a hidden crypt in Thuringia?

programme.title: Cities of Gold: The Reality Behind the Myth
programme.desc: Spanning from the Columbian mountains to the deserts of Peru, the discoveries made in this archaeological investigation revolutionise our perception of gold and its role over the last 500 years.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.sub-title: The ancient Minoan civilisation thrived for centuries in the islands of the Aegean before their culture was abruptly ended by a catastrophic volcanic explosion.
programme.desc: Why do civilisations collapse? Follow archaeologists as they examine ruins across the world and uncover the reasons why some of historys greatest civilisations vanished.

programme.title: The Pharaohs: Greater Than The Pyramids
programme.sub-title: A legendary conqueror, Alexander the Great left his mark on Egypt; this episode explores the mystery surrounding his tomb that symbolises the eternal appeal of his story.
programme.desc: Djoser, Khufu, Ramses II, Ramses III, Alexander the Great and Cleopatra - this series explores the life and reign of these pharaohs while illuminating their relationship with other Pharaonic figures.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Hitlers invasion of the Rhineland was a gamble that paid off as his push west remained unchecked; while the leaders of Europe attempt peace, Kristallnacht signalled the horrors yet to come to many.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: The Rise of the Dictators
programme.sub-title: History is filled with examples of how dictators have come to power, but what are the common themes, what are the circumstances that lead to tyranny, and what techniques do they use to get to the top?
programme.desc: Told through six themed episodes, this series explores how dictators rise to power in a compelling insight into the fragility of democracy and the frightening resilience of authoritarianism.

programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: A team of experts investigate the methods Hitler used to indoctrinate Germany, turning it into a finely-tuned war machine; we visit Goebbels Propaganda Ministry and the holiday park of Prora.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Genghis Khans Mongolia
programme.sub-title: This first episode charts Chinggis Khaans childhood as an outcast living in harsh conditions on the barren landscape - before he rose up and united all of the nomadic communities across the steppe.
programme.desc: We explore the evolution of the Mongol Empire, from its humble beginnings to becoming an extraordinary force; they conquered vast territories and came to be four times larger than the Roman Empire.

programme.title: Deadmans Curse: The Lost Spanish Gold
programme.sub-title: Early 1900s newspaper reports claim that Taylors ancestor Slumach placed a curse on his mine; a history of missing and dead prospectors support this claim, but where does legend end and truth begin?
programme.desc: A former MMA fighter, an Indigenous explorer, and a mountaineer set out into the wilderness of the Pacific Northwest to solve the 100-year-old mystery of Slumachs lost gold mine.

programme.title: The Black Pharaohs
programme.desc: About 4000 years ago, strong kings ruled for over 1500 years in the land of Kush (now northern Sudan and southern Egypt) - who were these African kings and what happened to them?

programme.title: Greatest Events of World War II In Colour
programme.sub-title: Britain and France declare war when Hitler invades Poland; in May 1940, the Germans attack Holland and Belgium as a decoy. As the Wehrmacht and Luftwaffe strike in force, the French seem trapped.
programme.desc: A story of World War II told through the ten most pivotal moments in the conflict, supported by exquisitely restored and colourised footage. This is World War II as youve never seen it before.

programme.title: The Rise of the Dictators
programme.sub-title: History is filled with examples of how dictators have come to power, but what are the common themes, what are the circumstances that lead to tyranny, and what techniques do they use to get to the top?
programme.desc: Told through six themed episodes, this series explores how dictators rise to power in a compelling insight into the fragility of democracy and the frightening resilience of authoritarianism.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: Hitlers invasion of the Rhineland was a gamble that paid off as his push west remained unchecked; while the leaders of Europe attempt peace, Kristallnacht signalled the horrors yet to come to many.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.
